page.title: 09GAMES PLAYED AT OLDBURY
page.content: {MARBLES.}We play marbles in school. There are several sizes of marbles. First we tap marbles, you tap a different amount of times according to the size of the marbles. This means the game is for keeps. Then you roll your marble on the ground and your opponent tries to hit it. You can do different things with your marble like a rolling throw or bombing. When you hit your opponents marble you win it. {CONKERS.}We play conkers in the autumn because the conkers fall then. If you bake them they go hard, so it is easier to smash the opponents conker. You push a hole through the conker and thread some string through the conker. You hold the conker up in the air and above your waist. The other person tries to hit it. You take turns alternatively until the conker breaks.
